raw_text:
Smith loses US box office crown
 
 New comedy Diary of a Mad Black Woman has ended Will Smith's reign at the top of the North American box office.
 
 Based on a play by Tyler Perry, who also stars as a gun-toting grandmother, the film took $22.7m (£11.8m) in its first three days of release. After topping the chart for two consecutive weeks, Smith's romantic comedy Hitch dropped to second place with takings of $21m (£10.9m). Keanu Reeves' supernatural thriller Constantine dropped a place to three. Based on the Hellblazer comics, the film took $11.8m (£6.1m) on its second week of release. Two new entries came next in the chart, with Wes Craven's horror movie Cursed, about a werewolf loose in Los Angeles, in fourth position with $9.5m (£4.9m).
 
 Action comedy Man of the House, starring Tommy Lee Jones as a Texas ranger assigned to protect a cheerleader squad, came in at fifth with $9m (£4.6m). Clint Eastwood's boxing drama Million Dollar Baby - recipient of four Academy Awards, including best picture - continued to perform well in sixth place with takings of $7.2m (£3.74m). Martin Scorsese's Hollywood biopic The Aviator - which won five Oscars, all in minor categories - held on in ninth place. The low-budget feature Diary of a Mad Black Woman stars Kimberly Elise as a woman thrown out on the streets by her philandering husband. With the help of her grandmother Madea (one of three roles played by Perry), she plots revenge. Perry, 34, is one of America's best-known black playwrights but is a newcomer to film. Once made homeless after investing his own money in unsuccessful productions of his work, he now lives in the mansion in which Diary of a Mad Black Woman was filmed.
llama3.2:1b: Will Smith's "Hitch" drops to second place at US box office; "Diary of a Mad Black Woman" takes $22.7m (£11.8m) in first three days of release, topping chart for two weeks.
llama3.2:3b: Will Smith's romantic comedy Hitch has dropped to second place at the US box office behind new comedy Diary of a Mad Black Woman. The film starring Tyler Perry and Kimberly Elise earned $22.7m in its first three days, while Hitch took $21m. Keanu Reeves' Constantine fell to third with $11.8m.
gemma2:2b: "Diary of a Mad Black Woman" has overtaken Will Smith's "Hitch" as top box office hit in North America.  The Tyler Perry-starring comedy grossed $22.7 million in its first three days, while "Hitch" dropped to second with $21 million. "Constantine," and "Man of the House" also saw box office movement within the top ten.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Diary of a Mad Black Woman, starring Will Smith, has been on the North American box office since March 21, taking its first three days to $22.7 million and ending with a second place performance in April 2018. The film's two new entries (Constantine from Keanu Reeves, Cursed by Wes Craven) are third and fourth respectively. Man of the House stars Tommy Lee Jones and continues to perform well. The low-budget feature Diary of a Mad Black Woman is about Kimberly Elise as a woman thrown out on the streets, with Perry playing one of Smith's best-known black playwrights.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Will Smith loses box office crown to comedy about revenge from Tyler Perry; three other films also perform well.
qwen2.5:3b: Diary of a Mad Black Woman took over Will Smith’s top US box office position with $22.7m in its opening weekend, following Hitch and Constantine. The film stars Tyler Perry as a gun-toting grandmother. Man of the House came fifth, while Million Dollar Baby and The Aviator held onto sixth and ninth places respectively. Perry made her acting debut in Mad Black Woman after previously working solely in theater.

deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Will Smith losing a box office crown. Let me read through it carefully.

The first paragraph talks about New comedy diary of a mad black woman ending its run at the top of US box office. It's based on a Tyler Perry play. The film made $22 million in its first three days, which is pretty good. Then, Will Smith's hit romantic comedy Hitch dropped to second place with $21 million.

Next part introduces another film from Tyler Perry, Keanu Reeves' Constantine. That got third place with $21 million too. Before that, there was Wes Craven's Cursed, which was fourth with $9.5 million. Two new films follow: Man of the House at fifth place and Million Dollar Baby sixth with $7.2 million.

Then it goes into some other films. The horror movie Aviator won several Oscars but was ninth overall because Martin Scorsese made it in ninth place, though he got multiple minor awards. The diary film stars Kimberly Elise as a woman whose husband is philandering, using Madea from his play to plan revenge. Madea is one of three black actresses in the film, and it's a low-budget film.

I need to make sure I include all these points: New comedy losing crown, based on Tyler Perry play, $22M first week; Hitch at second with $21M; Constantine third with $21M; Cursed fourth with $9.5M; Man of the House fifth with $9M; Million Dollar Baby sixth with $7.2M; the diary film stars Elise and Madea as a black actress; made homeless, now in a mansion; others mentioned briefly.

I should keep the summary concise but include all key details without any extra fluff.
</think>

New comedy diary of a mad black woman has ended its run at the top of US box office after based on Tyler Perry play, with $22 million in its first three days. Will Smith's Man of the House was second with $21 million. Keanu Reeves' Constantine dropped to third with $21 million, Wes Craven's Cursed fourth with $9.5 million. The diary film stars Elise and Madea, a black actress, and it's low-budget despite its success.
tinyllama:1.1b: Smith loses US box office crown after losing top spot to new comedy 'Diairy of a Mad Black Woman' with $22.7 million in its first three days, while supernatural thriller 'Constantine' drops from third place to third. Two new entries continue their strong showing at the box office, with horror movie 'Hitman: Chronicles of Hell' coming in fourth, and Wes Craven's supernatural thriller 'Curse' following in fifth position. Action comedy 'Man of the House' continues its strong hold on the charts, taking second place, while martial arts film 'Million Dollar Baby' holds down sixth spot, despite losing the top spot to a newbie in 'The Aviator'. Clint Eastwood's boxing drama 'The Aviator' also holds onto ninth spot.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
The North American box office dominance of Will Smith's sci-fi romance comedy hit movie, "Hitch," has been broken by Tyler Perry's playful satire "Diary of a Mad Black Woman." 

In the first three days of release, "Hitch" secured first place with earnings of $21 million, followed by Will Smith's latest film, "Gone in 60 Seconds," which took second place with $22.7 million. 

Based on the popular comic book series "Hellblazer," the film "Cursed" also performed well, taking third place with earnings of $9.5 million. In fourth place, Wes Craven's horror movie, "Cursed," was released in the market, while action comedy "Man of the House" starring Tommy Lee Jones also enjoyed success, taking fifth position with $9 million. 

The action comedy, "Million Dollar Baby," directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Morgan Freeman, also performed well, taking sixth place with earnings of $7.2 million. In seventh place, Martin Scorsese's Hollywood biopic "The Aviator" received five Academy Awards but won four Oscars in the minor categories, making it a strong performer in the box office. 

In ninth place, Kimberly Elise continued to make waves as the lead character in "Diary of a Mad Black Woman," an action-packed black comedy with a grandmother played by Tyler Perry. With revenge on her mind and help from her grandmother, she plots to take down her philandering husband. 

The low-budget feature "Diary of a Mad Black Woman," starring Kimberly Elise as a woman thrown out on the streets and with the help of her grandmother Madea (one of three roles played by Perry), plans to continue taking center stage in box office history.

The film has grossed over $22.7 million in its first three days and topped the chart for two consecutive weeks, losing to Will Smith's romantic comedy Hitch with takings of $21 million. Constantine dropped a place to third position. Wes Craven's horror movie Cursed, based on the Hellblazer comics, came in fourth with $11.8 million on its second week of release. Action comedy Man of the House, starring Tommy Lee Jones as a Texas ranger assigned to protect a cheerleader squad, was fifth with $9.5 million. Clint Eastwood's boxing drama Million Dollar Baby is sixth place with $7.2 million, while Martin Scorsese' Hollywood biopic The Aviator continues to perform well in ninth position with over $10 million. Diary of a Mad Black Woman stars Kimberly Elise as a woman who gets revenge on her cheating husband with the help of her grandmother Madea played by Tyler Perry, who is one of America's best-known black playwrights.

The low-budget feature Diary of a Mad Black Woman stars Kimberly Elise as a woman thrown out on the streets by her philandering husband. With the help of her grandmother Madea (one of three roles played by Perry), she plots revenge. Perry, 34, is one of America's best-known black playwrights but is a newcomer to film. hermes3:3b:
Will Smith's "Diary of a Mad Black Woman" overtakes box office

Smith loses US crown as new comedy by Tyler Perry takes top position with $22.7m.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Diary of a Mad Black Woman, based on a play by Tyler Perry and starring Perry himself, has taken over from Will Smith as the top film at the North American box office. It made $22.7m (£11.8m) in its first three days of release. Hitch dropped to second place with $21m (£10.9m). Constantine moved up a place to third based on Hellblazer comics, taking $11.8m (£6.1m). Wes Craven's horror film Cursed came fourth, followed by action comedy Man of the House in fifth with $9m (£4.6m) and Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby in sixth with $7.2m (£3.74m). Martin Scorsese's The Aviator held on in ninth place. Diary of a Mad Black Woman tells the story of a woman betrayed by her husband, helped by her grandmother Madea, who seeks revenge after investing her own money in unsuccessful productions of her work and becoming homeless.
chatgpt-4o-latest: Diary of a Mad Black Woman, a comedy based on Tyler Perry's play, debuted at the top of the North American box office with $22.7 million, ending Will Smith's two-week reign with Hitch, which dropped to second place with $21 million. Keanu Reeves' Constantine fell to third with $11.8 million. New entries included Wes Craven's horror film Cursed in fourth with $9.5 million and action comedy Man of the House in fifth with $9 million. Clint Eastwood's Oscar-winning Million Dollar Baby remained strong in sixth, while Martin Scorsese's The Aviator held ninth. Diary of a Mad Black Woman stars Kimberly Elise as a woman seeking revenge on her unfaithful husband, with Perry playing multiple roles, including a gun-toting grandmother. Perry, a well-known black playwright, overcame homelessness to achieve success, even filming the movie in his own mansion.

After topping the chart for two weeks, romantic comedy Hitch dropped to second place. Keanu Reeves' supernatural thriller Constantine ranks third, while new entries include action comedy Man of the House and Wes Craven's horror movie Cursed. The Aviator held in ninth position by Martin Scorsese.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Will Smith's two-week reign as the top-grossing North American box office star ended with the release of Tyler Perry's Diary of a Mad Black Woman, a comedy based on his play. The film grossed $22.7m in its opening weekend, surpassing Smith's previous hit Hitch, which took second place with $21m after two weeks. Constantine, starring Keanu Reeves, fell to third, generating $11.8m during its second week. New entries included Wes Craven's horror movie Cursed, fourth with $9.5m, and Tommy Lee Jones' action comedy Man of the House in fifth, earning $9m. Clint Eastwood's Million Dollar Baby and Martin Scorsese's The Aviator maintained their positions at sixth and ninth, respectively. Diary of a Mad Black Woman features Kimberly Elise as an abused woman seeking revenge with her grandmother Madea (played by Perry), who is a well-known black playwright but new to film after facing financial hardships due to unsuccessful productions of his works.
